context.description: If enabled, new workspace files are automatically opened for add.
If enabled, displays markers indicating files you have added to the project but have not added to Perforce.

If disabled, files are automatically opened in the default changelist. If enabled, a dialog is displayed, enabling you to choose the changelist. To move files among changelists, drag and drop them in the Pending Changelist pane (Window>Show View>Perforce Pending Changelists).

When enabled, performs Perforce operations in conjunction with file-based workbench operations such as delete, edit, and rename/refactor. In Perforce, renaming is accomplished by deleting a file and integrating it to a new file, to preserve file ancestry.
When enabled, opens files for deletion from the depot when you delete them from your workspace.
Specifies that the location of the p4 executable is found using the current search path.
Allows the location of the p4 executable to be specified.
Specifies the full path to the p4 executable.
Browse directories to specify the location of the p4 executable.
Specifies that all open jobs are retrieved from the Perforce server.
Limits the number of jobs retrieved from the Perforce server (huge job retrievals can affect performance).
Specifies the maximum number of jobs to retrieve.
Specifies that all submitted changelists are retrieved from the Perforce server.
Limits the number of submitted changelists retrieved from the Perforce server (huge changelist retrievals can affect performance).
Specifies the maximum number of submitted changelists to retrieve at one time.
Commands sent to the Perforce server are displayed in this color in the Perforce Console pane.
Informative messages from the Perforce server are displayed in this color in the Perforce Console pane.
Error messages from the Perforce server are displayed in this color in the Perforce Console pane.
All text in the Perforce Console pane is displayed using this font.
Display the revision number in your workspace and the latest revision in the depot
Display the Perforce file type.
Display the action, if any, currently being performed on the file.
Display the host and port for the Perforce server configured for this project.
Display the Perforce client specification configured for this project.
Display the Perforce user configured for this project.
If this option is selected then all resources contained in a .p4ignore file will be decorated.
Specifies the location where the "open" icon is displayed.
Specifies the location where the "sync" icon is displayed.
Specifies the location where the "not synced" icon is displayed.
Specifies the location where the "unresolved" icon is displayed.
Specifies the location where the "lock" icon is displayed.
Specifies the location where the "open in other workspace" icon is displayed.
This pane displays the commands sent to the Perforce Server. For details about the commands, refer to the Perforce Command Reference.
'Clear' deletes the contents of the Status pane.
The revision history pane displays the changes you have submitted to Perforce for the selected file. The Changelist number is assigned by Perforce to group related changes.
'Refresh' retrieves the latest file history information from the Perforce Server and updates the display.
This pane lists Perforce changelists that have not been submitted to the depot. The files in these changelists are being changed by you or other users.
'Refresh' retrieves the latest file status information from the Perforce Server and updates the display.
'New Changelist' creates a numbered changelist. If files are open in the default changelist, the files are moved to the new numbered changelist.
This pane lists Perforce changelists that have been submitted to the depot.
'Refresh' retrieves the latest changelist information from the Perforce Server and updates the display.
Delete selected entry from the list of submitted changelist filters.
The depot pane enables you to browse the contents of a Perforce server.
'Refresh' retrieves the latest file status information from the Perforce Server and updates the display.
Specify search criteria to list specific jobs (example: ReportedDate>=2004/01/01).
Delete selected entry from the list of job filters.
List of jobs that you can attach to the changelist you are submitting.
Full description of selected job.
'Sync to Head' copies the most recent file revisions from the depot to your computer.
'Add to Source Control' opens the project files for add in a Perforce changelist. When you submit the changelist, the files are added to the depot.
'Add to .p4ignore' adds a file to the list of files ignored by P4WSAD.
'Edit' opens a file for edit in a Perforce changelist. When you submit the changelist, the file containing your changes is submitted to the depot

>'Delete' opens a file for delete in a Perforce changelist. When you submit the changelist, the head revision of the file is marked 'deleted' in the depot. Note that previous revisions of the file remain in the depot.
'Revert' discards changes you have made to the selected file(s) and removes them from the changelist.
'Revision History' displays the revision history for the selected project in the Perforce Revision History pane.
'Refresh' retrieves the latest file status information from the Perforce Server and update the display.
'Remove from Client' removes the project files from workspace (the files remain in the Perforce depot, if previously added).
'Recover Deleted File' recovers a file using the current revision on the Client or using the next to last revision if no revision on Client.
'Diff File(s) Against Depot' enables you to see the changes you have made to the file after you opened it for edit.
'Change File Type' enables you to specify the Perforce file type assigned to the file. The file type enables Perforce determine how to store files and whether files can be diffed.
Prevent all other users from submitting changes to this file.
Re-enable users to submit changes to this file.
'Resolve Interactively' displays a dialog containing the various resolve options, enabling you to decide precisely how to resolve the file.
'Manual Resolve' opens the Eclipse merge editor that allows the user to merge changes manually.
'Auto Resolve' displays a dialog listing simple resolve options. If you need to combine your changes with changes made by other users, use a merge program instead of these simple options.

'Schedule For Resolve' notifies the Perforce Server that a conflict exists for the specified file. For example, if the file has been edited by you and another user simultaneously, the file needs to be resolved to determine which changes are to be retained. Refer to the Perforce Users Guide for details.
Copies the most recent file revisions from the depot to your computer.
Copies a specific revision of the file from the depot to your computer.
'Submit' sends your changed files to the Perforce Server for storage in the depot.
'Revert Unchanged Files' closes files that you opened but did not change.
'Add Job Fix' enables you to close a job when the changelist is submitted.
'Edit Spec' displays the changelist, enabling you to revise the description and choose which files to submit.
'Delete Empty Changelist' deletes a Perforce changelist that contains no files.
Move selected file to a different changelist.
'Unfix Job' removes a job that was previously attached to a changelist.
'Unmanage' removes Perforce as the configured source code management tool for the project. Note that any checked-in files remain in the depot, and any pending changelists are not deleted.
Attempt to reconnect with Perforce server after having been offline.
View authentication settings and status
Lists recently used Perforce server hosts and ports.
Specify the host and port of the computer where the Perforce Server is running in the format host:port.
Specify your Perforce user name
Specify the name of the client workspace where your Websphere projects reside.
The password for the Perforce user configured for this project.
The character set used by your client computer. DO NOT SET unless connecting to a server that is running in UNICODE mode!
Test the Perforce server connection settings specified on this dialog.

This dialog enables you to choose files to open and specify the changelist in which they are opened. Use changelists to group changes to related files. When you submit a changelist, all the changed files are sent to the depot as a group.
This file is open for add, edit, or delete. Uncheck it if you do not want to submit it in this changelist.
Choose the changelist into which the selected files will be opened.
This list shows all unopened files that are different to the revision in the depot. The selected files will be opened for edit.
This list shows all unopened files that are missing from the client workspace. The selected files will be opened for delete.
This list shows all files that are not under Perforce control. The list excludes files that are ignored. The selected files will be opened for add.
Resolve only the files you selected in the changelist pane.
Resolve all files in the changelist.
Accept the latest version in the depot and disregard your changes.
Check your changes in, superseding the changes made to the latest version in the depot.

If either your file or their file (but not both files) are different from the base file, accept the differing version of the file as the head revision. If both files are different from base file, do not perform a resolve on this file.

If their file is identical to the base file, accept your file as the head revision. If your file is identical to the base file, accept their file as the head revision. If your file and their file are both different from the base file, but there are no conflicts between yours and their file, accept a merge of the two files as the head revision. Otherwise, if there are conflicts between your file and their file, do not perform resolve on this file.

Accept the merged file as the head revision regardless of the status of yours and their files. If conflicts are found in the two file versions, the conflicts are marked and retained. The file must then be edited manually to eliminate the conflicts.
Schedule already-resolved files to be resolved again.
Enable the use of the textual merge tool on any binary files scheduled for resolve.
This form enables you to describe the changes you have made to the files you are submitting. Verify that the files you want to submit are checked in the Files list.
Check only the files you want to submit in this changelist.
Check if you want to submit files and immediately reopen them for edit.
change_spec_jobs
Display a list of jobs you can attach to the changelist. The selected jobs are fixed (closed) when you submit the changelist.
Select (check) all files in changelist for submission.
Deselect (uncheck) all files in changelist to prevent submission.
A file that contains ASCII text.
A non-text file
A symbolic link
A file containing Unicode characters. Use only with Perforce servers in international mode.
Macintosh resource file
Dual-fork Macintosh file
Execute bit is set in workspace when you sync file (for programs stored in Perforce)
Keep file writaeble after submit (by default, files are set to read-only)
Expand any RCS keywords when file is submitted (for text files)
Expand only the $Id and $Header RCS keywords
Do not change file modification time when submitting or syncing
Do not allow more than one user to open the file
Store the file using Perforce defaults for compression and delta or full revision
Store the full compressed version of each file revision (binary files)
Store RCS deltas (text files)
Server stores full file per revision (use for Postscript and other textual formats that would otherwise be stored as deltas)
Store only the most recent revision of a file.
This dialog enables you to remove unchanged files from a changelist. Reverting unchanged files helps keep changelists small and avoids creating unnecessary revisions in the depot.
Displays the results of testing the connection to the Perforce Server.
move_change_changelists
auth_remember_password
auth_use_login
